ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend VIET 140 to another student if they already have a good background in Vietnamese and want to improve it. Be wary of the high expectations of what you need to know.

Definitely take Vietnamese L. 4 if your Vietnamese is already at a decent level. You'll learn a lot more vocabulary in L. 4, and although the class is every day, the homework is manageable. The professor is excellent, and learning Vietnamese is quite fun I think. Class is small, and usually you bond a lot with the other students in the class. The other students are really cool! Thay Quang makes the class amazing, and I promise you that you will like him a lot. Learning Vietnamese, especially if you are Vietnamese American, is a valuable thing. I enjoyed this class a lot, and I think you will to! Shop it at least.
Absolutely take this course to understand more about Vietnsmese culture and language.
